info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 26 at 2:20PM MST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...VERY COLD WEATHER EXPECTED LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY... After the snow ends Monday night skies will clear and temperatures will become extremely cold late Monday night through Thursday. Low temperatures in the Treasure and Magic Valleys Tuesday through Thursday mornings will be in the single digits above zero, while in the mountain valleys and basins lows will be generally zero to 15 below zero. High temperatures on those days will be generally between 15 and 25 degrees above zero. Tuesday night through Thursday will not be quite as cold as previously expected due to fewer hours of clearing. Fortunately, most winds will stay below 10 mph during the coldest periods, but the Camas Prairie will have dangerous wind chill near 25 below zero Tuesday morning, with a significant risk of frostbite. Other areas will have lighter winds and will not be quite so cold, but even light winds can lead to frostbite at those temperatures.
